title: Supreme Court will decide on use of warrants that collect the location history of cellphone users
snippet: Supreme Court will decide on use of warrants that collect the location history of cellphone users

title: Philippines Bans Grok Website, Eyes X Talks as Backlash Grows
snippet: The Philippines blocked access to the website of Elon Musk’s Grok artificial intelligence chatbot as a global backlash grows over sexualized images of people generated by the AI system.

title: Instagram announces AI-powered reel translation for five more Indian languages: here's how it works
snippet: Instagram is expanding its AI voice translate feature to five Indian languages: Bengali, Tamil, Telugu, Kannada, and Marathi. Users will soon be able to dub and lip-sync reels, preserving the creator's voice and mouth movements.&nbsp;

title: Motorola Signature to launch in India on 23 January: Snapdragon 8 Gen 5, 165Hz display and other key specs revealed
snippet: Motorola will launch its flagship device, the Motorola Signature, in India on January 23 via Flipkart. It features a Snapdragon 8 Gen 5 processor, 16GB RAM, and 1TB storage. The phone also promises 7 years of OS updates and AI photography enhancements.

title: iPhone 17 Pro, iPhone 17 Pro Max, iPhone Air get massive discount during Amazon Republic Day sale: Check complete offer
snippet: Amazon's Republic Day sale is showcasing various discounts on th iPhone 17 series. The iPhone 17 Pro Max is available for  ₹1,40,400 after discounts, while the iPhone Air is priced at  ₹91,249.&nbsp;

title: Mother of Elon Musk’s child sues xAI, alleges Grok generated explicit deepfakes of her
snippet: Ashley St Clair, Elon Musk's child's mother, has sued xAI for generating explicit deepfake images of her via Grok AI. She claims emotional distress and loss of privacy, while xAI counters that she breached the contract by filing in the wrong court. Several countries are considering banning Grok.

title: What is Merge Labs? OpenAI invests in Sam Altman-backed BCI startup taking on Neuralink
snippet: OpenAI is investing in Sam Altman's BCI startup Merge Labs, which aims to enhance human capabilities through innovative brain-computer interfaces.&nbsp;

title: OpenAI is taking on Google Translate with new ChatGPT powered translator: how to use, features and more
snippet: OpenAI has introduced ChatGPT Translate, a new AI tool aimed at competing with Google Translate.The new tool offers translation for over 50 languages, understands tone and context, and allows users to customize translations.&nbsp;

title: Verizon issues $20 credits to customers after massive outage: How to claim, when will you get it? — all FAQs answered
snippet: Verizon credit for outage: $20 credits issued to customers affected by massive outage caused by a ‘software issue’. The company acknowledged not meeting customer expectations and stated the credits would compensate for multiple days of service.

title: Nothing confirms its first India flagship store in Bengaluru: All you need to know
snippet: Nothing has confirmed plans to open its first flagship store in India in Bengaluru. The upcoming outlet will offer hands-on access to its smartphones, earbuds and other devices, marking the brand’s second flagship store worldwide.

Reliance’s JioMart hits 1.6 million daily orders, claims to be second-largest qcomm player in India
snippet: JioMart now operates across more than 5,000 pin codes, supported by over 3,000 stores in over 1,000 cities. Without disclosing exact figures, Reliance claimed that transaction frequency on its digital platforms is roughly twice that of competitors.

title: Wipro Q3 profit misses estimates as one-time charges drag profit
snippet: Srini Pallia, CEO, Wipro: Clients are definitely looking to take costs out through vendor consolidation, and bring the efficiency and productivity through AI into the existing run and operate situations

title: Tech Mahindra posts strongest December quarter in three years
snippet: Tech Mahindra posted its strongest quarterly performance in three years, with net profit rising 14% year-on-year to Rs 1,122 crore and revenue up 8% to Rs 14,393 crore, supported by large deal wins and core vertical growth. Margins improved for the ninth consecutive quarter, aided by operational eff

title: Quick commerce market heats up; Blinkit drops delivery fees in select markets
snippet: Blinkit has cut delivery fees in select micro-markets like Gurgaon, Bengaluru and Mumbai to stay competitive against Amazon Now and Flipkart Minutes. Other quick commerce players, including Zepto and Instamart, had already reduced charges. The move aims to retain customers as rapid expansion and dar

title: Dealmaking via Mauritius may be a road less taken
snippet: The Supreme Court’s ruling against Tiger Global could reshape how foreign investors use Mauritius-based entities to invest in India. Funds must now show genuine “substance” in these jurisdictions, or face Indian tax scrutiny. The verdict may also affect other treaty-based investments and indirect sh

title: Tiger in net, blackstone in woods: Supreme Court's Tiger Global tax ruling could influence Blackstone dispute
snippet: Blackstone faces a significant legal challenge from India's tax department. The dispute centers on tax residency and treaty benefits for foreign investors. This case, similar to the Tiger Global matter, will test the validity of tax residency certificates. The outcome could impact how offshore inves

title: OpenAI introducing ads to ChatGPT
snippet: OpenAI will soon test ads on ChatGPT in the US for free and lower-tier users, aiming to cover rising operational costs. The company stressed that ads will not affect responses or user privacy. With few paying subscribers, OpenAI is seeking new revenue while competing with AI rivals like Google.

title: ETtech Deals Digest: Startups raise $191 million this week, down 51% on-year
snippet: Indian startups raised about $190.7 million in mid-January, sharply lower than a year ago but well above the previous week’s total. Funding activity also slowed, with fewer deals completed year on year. Healthcare, education and consumer brands led the biggest transactions during the week.

title: ClickHouse lands $15 billion valuation in AI database race
snippet: ClickHouse has raised $400 million in fresh funding, lifting its valuation to $15 billion as investor interest in AI infrastructure grows. The database firm builds real-time analytics tools used in developing AI systems and counts major tech companies among its customers. The funding will support pr

title: I-T dept to proceed with Tiger Global's capital gains tax assessment in 2018 Flipkart-Walmart deal
snippet: Following the Supreme Court's ruling, India’s tax department will resume assessing capital gains from Tiger Global’s 2018 Flipkart exit. snippet: Agreement will reduce tariffs on goods from the country to 15%

snippet: Emissions from air freight have increased by 25% since 2019, according to a 2024 analysis by environmental advocacy organization Stand.Earth.
